intervention_catalogue.name: Healthy Identity Intervention
intervention_catalogue.short_description: Healthy Identity Intervention (HII) targets the social and psychological drivers of extremist offending. It helps participants disengage from extremist groups, causes, or ideologies and to reconnect with their own personal values and beliefs.
intervention_catalogue.long_description: Healthy Identity Intervention (HII) targets the social and psychological drivers of extremist offending. It helps participants disengage from extremist groups, causes, or ideologies and to reconnect with their own personal values and beliefs.

eligibility_offence.motivation: or under other legislation where extremism is identified as a motivation by the Court.

possible_outcomes: Assist participant to desist from crime
Facilitate disengagement from an extremist group, cause, or ideology

risk_consideration.pna_guide: 22+ ERG (Extremism Risk Guidance) and an assessment

special_educational_needs.learning_disability_catered_for: Yes, but reviewed case by case
